ar: بِسۡمِ اللّٰہِ الرَّحۡمٰنِ الرَّحِیۡمِ﴿۱﴾
ur: اللہ کے نام کے ساتھ جو بے انتہا رحم کرنے والا، بِن مانگے دینے والا (اور) بار بار رحم کرنے والا ہے۔

v5.text: [a]In the name of Allah, the Gracious, the Merciful.

notes.note: See 1:1.

ar: ہَلۡ  اَتٰی عَلَی الۡاِنۡسَانِ حِیۡنٌ مِّنَ الدَّہۡرِ  لَمۡ  یَکُنۡ شَیۡئًا مَّذۡکُوۡرًا ﴿۲﴾
ur: کیا انسان پر زمانے میں سے کوئی ایسا لمحہ بھی آیا تھا کہ وہ کوئی قابلِ ذکر چیز نہیں تھا؟

v5.text: Has there not come upon man a period of time when he was not a thing spoken of [b],[4479]

notes.note:
Important Words:

حین (period) is derived from حان. They say حان الشیء i.e. the time of the thing came near, it happened. حین means, time or a space or period of time, any time; a continuous time; an appointed time; time absolutely; the time when an event takes place; time without end (Lane & Aqrab).

الدھر (time) is infinitive noun from دھر. They say دھر القوم أمر مکروہ i.e. an evil event befell the people. دھر means, time from the beginning of the world to the end; any long or unlimited period of time; a period of time whether long or short; time without end, differing from زمان which means, time having end. دھر also means, an age; fate or fortune; an evil event or accident; a misfortune; a calamity, a purpose; a desire; the end that one has in view; a custom or habit (Lane & Aqrab).

Commentary:

الانسان (man) in this and the next verse does not mean human species as such, but every man. The verse means that before man is born, he is not mentioned, spoken of, or referred to; the reference being to his insignificant and unmentionable beginning.

ar: اِنَّا خَلَقۡنَا الۡاِنۡسَانَ مِنۡ نُّطۡفَۃٍ  اَمۡشَاجٍ ٭ۖ  نَّبۡتَلِیۡہِ  فَجَعَلۡنٰہُ سَمِیۡعًۢا بَصِیۡرًا ﴿۳﴾
ur: یقیناً ہم نے انسان کو ایک مرکّب نطفہ سے پیدا کیا جسے ہم طرح طرح کی شکلوں میں ڈھالتے ہیں۔ پھر اُسے ہم نے سننے (اور) دیکھنے والا بنادیا۔

v5.text: [c]We have created man from a mingled sperm drop that We might try him; so We made him hearing, seeing.[4480]

notes.note:
Commentary:

أمشاج is the plural of مشیج which means, a mixture. Man is created from a sperm drop which itself is a mixture of several things, the implication being that he has been endowed with various natural powers, faculties and attributes meant for his moral and spiritual advance. This process of the creation of man points only to a general rule of creation; not that in no case could it be otherwise. The fact that man is gifted with insight and understanding signifies that he is a free agent, enjoying discretion and volition; therefore he is responsible for his actions. The belief in man’s freedom of action and responsibility leads inevitably to the belief in the Hereafter.

ar: اِنَّا ہَدَیۡنٰہُ  السَّبِیۡلَ  اِمَّا شَاکِرًا وَّ اِمَّا کَفُوۡرًا ﴿۴﴾
ur: یقیناً ہم نے اُسے سیدھے رستے کی طرف ہدایت دی۔ خواہ (وہ) شکرگزار بنتے ہوئے (چلے) خواہ ناشکرا ہوتے ہوئے۔

v5.text: We have shown him the way,[a] whether he be grateful or ungrateful.[4481]

notes.note:
Commentary:

God has given man reason and understanding. He has made him responsible for his actions, and through His Messengers and Prophets has shown him the way that leads to God-realization. But it is for man to make right use of God-given faculties and opportunities (this being the meaning of شکر), and by submitting to Divine laws to achieve the object of his creation or by flouting them to bring about his spiritual death.

ar: اِنَّاۤ  اَعۡتَدۡنَا  لِلۡکٰفِرِیۡنَ سَلٰسِلَا۠ وَ اَغۡلٰلًا  وَّ  سَعِیۡرًا ﴿۵﴾
ur: یقیناً ہم نے کافروں کے لئے طرح طرح کی زنجیریں اور طوق اور ایک بھڑکتی ہوئی آگ تیار کئے ہیں۔

v5.text: [b]Verily, We have prepared for the disbelievers chains and iron-collars and a blazing Fire.[4482]

notes.note:
Commentary:

For a detailed explanation of the nature and significance of the punishments of Hell, see 69:30-33. Briefly, the verse alludes to the fact that every deed which a man does is followed by a corresponding act of God. The entanglements of dis-believers in worldly affairs will take the form of chains in the next world, cares of the world will take the form of iron-collars, and greed and carnal desires that of Hellfire.

topics.topic: Paradise: Jannah: rewards of, for the righteous men and women, the martyrs, the muhajirun, the patient, those who fear Allah, the penitent

ar: اِنَّ  الۡاَبۡرَارَ  یَشۡرَبُوۡنَ مِنۡ کَاۡسٍ کَانَ مِزَاجُہَا  کَافُوۡرًا ۚ﴿۶﴾
ur: یقیناً نیک لوگ ایک ایسے پیالے سے پیئیں گے جس کا مزاج کافوری ہوگا۔

v5.text: But the virtuous drink of a cup, tempered with camphor—[4483]

notes.note:
Important Words:

کافورا (camphor) is derived from کفر i.e. to cover or to suppress. The meaning is that the quaffing of camphor-drink will have the effect of cooling down animal passions. The heart of righteous believers will be cleansed of every impure thought and they will be refrigerated with the coolness of deep divine knowledge.

topics.topic: Paradise: Jannah: rewards of, for the righteous men and women, the martyrs, the muhajirun, the patient, those who fear Allah, the penitent

ar: عَیۡنًا یَّشۡرَبُ بِہَا عِبَادُ اللّٰہِ یُفَجِّرُوۡنَہَا تَفۡجِیۡرًا ﴿۷﴾
ur: ایک ایسا چشمہ جس سے اللہ کے بندے پیئیں گے جسے وہ پھاڑ پھاڑ کر کشادہ کرتے چلے جائیں گے۔

v5.text: A spring wherefrom the servants of Allah drink, making it gush forth abundantly.[4484]

notes.note:
Commentary:

Righteous believers will drink of cups which will be filled from springs which they have dug with great labour, i.e. the deeds which they had done in the earthly life would appear in the next world in the form of springs. This is the first stage of spiritual evolution which requires hard and continuous striving on the part of believers, because unless man brings under control, and suppresses, his evil propensities, he cannot make any spiritual progress. The "spring" mentioned in the verse is the spring of God’s love and Divine realization.

ar: یُوۡفُوۡنَ بِالنَّذۡرِ وَ یَخَافُوۡنَ یَوۡمًا کَانَ شَرُّہٗ  مُسۡتَطِیۡرًا ﴿۸﴾
ur: وہ (اپنی) منت پوری کرتے ہیں اور اس دن سے ڈرتے ہیں جس کا شر پھیل جانے والا ہے۔

v5.text: They fulfil their vow, and fear a day the evil of which is widespread.[4484A]

notes.note:
Commentary:

Fulfilling "the vow" signifies the discharging of man’s duties to God. Man’s obligations to his fellow-beings are mentioned in the next verse.

topics.topic: Alms: Sadaqah: give your to poor, needy

ar: وَ یُطۡعِمُوۡنَ  الطَّعَامَ عَلٰی حُبِّہٖ مِسۡکِیۡنًا وَّ  یَتِیۡمًا  وَّ  اَسِیۡرًا ﴿۹﴾
ur: اور وہ کھانے کو، اس کی چاہت کے ہوتے ہوئے، مسکینوں اور یتیموں اور اسیروں کو کھلاتے ہیں۔

v5.text: [a]And they feed, for love of Him, the poor, the orphan, and the prisoner,[4485]

notes.note:
Important Words:

طعام (food) is inf. noun from طعم i.e. he tasted or ate. طعام means, food; wholesome and agreeable food which satisfies the eater. They say ما یطعم آکل ھذا الطعام i.e. the eater of this food does not become satisfied (Lane).

Commentary:

The verse may mean: (1) Because they love God, so, in order to win His pleasure, they feed the poor and the captives. (2) They feed the poor for the sake of feeding them, i.e. they do the good act of feeding for the sake of doing good, seeking no reward, appreciation or approbation for what they do. (3) They feed the poor while they themselves need the money which they spend on others. The verse also signifies that the righteous believers give the poor wholesome and agreeable food, طعام meaning agreeable and wholesome food (Lane). This implies that the believers are expected to give in charity the things they love most. Elsewhere the Quran says: "You cannot attain to righteousness unless you spend in the way of Allah out of that which you love best (3:93).

ar: اِنَّمَا نُطۡعِمُکُمۡ لِوَجۡہِ اللّٰہِ لَا نُرِیۡدُ مِنۡکُمۡ جَزَآءً   وَّ  لَا  شُکُوۡرًا ﴿۱۰﴾
ur: ہم تمہیں محض اللہ کی رضا کی خاطر کھلا رہے ہیں، ہم ہرگز نہ تم سے کوئی بدلہ چاہتے ہیں اور نہ کوئی شکریہ۔

v5.text: Saying, ‘We feed you for Allah’s pleasure only. We desire no reward nor thanks from you.[4485A]

notes.note:
Commentary:

In everything that a believer does his whole attention is directed towards winning the pleasure of God—his highest ambition. He wants no return, reward or appreciation. His reward is with his Lord and Master.

ar: اِنَّا نَخَافُ مِنۡ رَّبِّنَا یَوۡمًا عَبُوۡسًا قَمۡطَرِیۡرًا ﴿۱۱﴾
ur: یقیناً ہم اپنے ربّ کی طرف سے (آنے والے) ایک تیوری چڑھائے ہوئے، نہایت سخت دن کا خوف رکھتے ہیں۔

v5.text: Verily, we fear from our Lord a frowning, distressful day.’[4486]

notes.note:
Important Words:

عبوساً (frowning) is derived from عبس. They say عبس وجھه i.e. he frowned; he grinned, frowning or looking sternly or austerely. یوم عبوس means, a distressful or calamitous day, or a day that makes one distressful (Lane).

قمطریر (calamitous) is derived from اقمطر which means, it was or became distressful or calamitous. یوم قمطریر means, a distressful or calamitous day, or a day that makes one knit the brow or contract the skin between the eyes. شر قمطریر means, an intense evil (Lane).

topics.topic: Paradise: Jannah: rewards of, for the righteous men and women, the martyrs, the muhajirun, the patient, those who fear Allah, the penitent

ar: فَوَقٰہُمُ  اللّٰہُ  شَرَّ ذٰلِکَ  الۡیَوۡمِ وَ لَقّٰہُمۡ نَضۡرَۃً   وَّ  سُرُوۡرًا ﴿ۚ۱۲﴾
ur: پس اللہ نے اُنہیں اس دن کے شر سے بچالیا اور انہیں تازگی اور لطف عطا کئے۔

v5.text: So Allah will save them from the evil of that day, and will grant them cheerfulness and happiness.

topics.topic: Jaza’: recompense: of believers, of righteous
Paradise: Jannah: rewards of, for the righteous men and women, the martyrs, the muhajirun, the patient, those who fear Allah, the penitent

ar: وَ جَزٰٮہُمۡ  بِمَا صَبَرُوۡا جَنَّۃً  وَّ حَرِیۡرًا ﴿ۙ۱۳﴾
ur: اور اس نے اُن کو بسبب اس کے کہ انہوں نے صبر کیا ایک جنت اور ایک قسم کے ریشم کی جزا دی۔

v5.text: [a]And He will reward them, for their steadfastness, with a Garden and a raiment of silk,

topics.topic: Paradise: Jannah: rewards of, for the righteous men and women, the martyrs, the muhajirun, the patient, those who fear Allah, the penitent

ar: مُّتَّکِـِٕیۡنَ فِیۡہَا عَلَی الۡاَرَآئِکِ ۚ لَا یَرَوۡنَ فِیۡہَا شَمۡسًا وَّ  لَا  زَمۡہَرِیۡرًا ﴿ۚ۱۴﴾
ur: وہ اس میں تختوں پر تکیہ لگائے بیٹھے ہوں گے۔ نہ تو وہ اُس میں سخت دھوپ دیکھیں گے اور نہ سخت سردی۔

v5.text: Reclining therein upon couches,[b] they will experience there neither excessive heat nor excessive cold[c].[4487]

notes.note:
Important Words:

زمھریرا (excessive cold) is derived from زمھر. They say زمھرت العین او ازمھرت i.e. the eye became red on account of anger. ازمھر الیومmeans, the day became intensely cold. ازمھر وجھه means, his face became contracted with a stern or morose look. زمھریرmeans, cold or intense cold (Lane & Aqrab).

topics.topic: Paradise: Jannah: rewards of, for the righteous men and women, the martyrs, the muhajirun, the patient, those who fear Allah, the penitent

ar: وَ دَانِیَۃً  عَلَیۡہِمۡ  ظِلٰلُہَا وَ ذُلِّلَتۡ قُطُوۡفُہَا تَذۡلِیۡلًا ﴿۱۵﴾
ur: اور اُس کے سائے اُن پر جھکے ہوئے ہوں گے اور اُس کے میوے پوری طرح جھکا دیئے جائیں گے۔

v5.text: And its shades will be close over them, and its clustered fruits will be brought within easy reach.

topics.topic: Paradise: Jannah: rewards of, for the righteous men and women, the martyrs, the muhajirun, the patient, those who fear Allah, the penitent

ar: وَ یُطَافُ عَلَیۡہِمۡ  بِاٰنِیَۃٍ  مِّنۡ  فِضَّۃٍ وَّ اَکۡوَابٍ کَانَتۡ قَؔوَارِیۡرَا۠ ﴿ۙ۱۶﴾
ur: اور ان پر چاندی کے برتنوں کا دور چلایا جائے گا اور ایسے کٹوروں کا جو شیشے کے ہوں گے۔

v5.text: [d]And vessels of silver will be passed round among them, and also goblets of glass,

topics.topic: Paradise: Jannah: rewards of, for the righteous men and women, the martyrs, the muhajirun, the patient, those who fear Allah, the penitent

ar: قَؔ‍وَارِیۡرَا۠ مِنۡ فِضَّۃٍ  قَدَّرُوۡہَا تَقۡدِیۡرًا ﴿۱۷﴾
ur: ایسے شیشے جو چاندی سے بنے ہوں گے۔ انہوں نے اُن کو بڑی مہارت سے ترکیب دیا ہوگا۔

v5.text: Bright as glass but made of silver, which they will measure according to their own measure.[4488]

notes.note:
Commentary:

The vessel from which the righteous will drink will be as white as silver and as bright and crystal clear as glass, and they will receive the paradisiacal drink in quantity according to the measure of the good deeds they had done in this life.

topics.topic: Paradise: Jannah: rewards of, for the righteous men and women, the martyrs, the muhajirun, the patient, those who fear Allah, the penitent

ar: وَ یُسۡقَوۡنَ  فِیۡہَا کَاۡسًا کَانَ مِزَاجُہَا زَنۡجَبِیۡلًا ﴿ۚ۱۸﴾
ur: اور وہ اُس میں ایک ایسے پیالے سے پلائے جائیں گے جس میں سونٹھ کی آمیزش ہوگی۔

v5.text: And therein will they be given to drink a cup tempered with ginger,[4489]

notes.note:
Commentary:

زنجبیل (ginger) is a compound of زنی (meaning to ascend) and جبل (meaning mountain). The compound word زنجبیل therefore means, "he ascended the mountain." زنجبیل or ginger is the root of a plant, very useful in promoting the natural heat of the body. The name given to it points to this property, for it gives strength to and generates heat in the weak body so as to enable a person to ascend precipitous heights. These two verses in which کافور (camphor) and زنجبیل (ginger) are respectively spoken of call attention to the two stages through which a believer has to pass in order to make advance, from the low position of slavery to passion, to the heights of virtue and righteousness. The first stage is that in which poisonous materials are suppressed and the flood of passions begins to subside. This we term the کافور (camphor) stage; for in this stage what is effected is only the suppression of poisonous matter, just as کافور has the property of nullifying the strong effect of passion. But the spiritual power which is required to overcome all difficulties is acquired in the second stage which is called the زنجبیل stage. The spiritual ginger (زنجبیل) which has the effect of a tonic on the spiritual system is the manifestation of Divine Beauty and Glory which affords nourishment to the soul. Braced with this manifestation, the spiritual wayfarer is able to traverse the dreary deserts and to climb the steep heights to be met with on his spiritual journey. To make men understand these two spiritual stages two words have been employed by the Quran, viz. کافور or that which suppresses poisonous matters and زنجبیل or that which gives strength to ascend spiritual heights and overcome all difficulties in the spiritual journey. Whereas at the کافور (camphor) stage the righteous will themselves drink the wine of God’s love, at the much higher زنجبیل (ginger) stage they will be served with this elixir.

topics.topic: Paradise: Jannah: rewards of, for the righteous men and women, the martyrs, the muhajirun, the patient, those who fear Allah, the penitent

ar: عَیۡنًا فِیۡہَا تُسَمّٰی سَلۡسَبِیۡلًا ﴿۱۹﴾
ur: ایک ایسا عجیب چشمہ اس میں ہوگا جو سلسبیل کہلائے گا۔

v5.text: There will be a spring herein named Salsabil.[4490]

notes.note:
Commentary:

The word سلسبیل literally meaning "enquire about the way," the verse purports to say that at the زنجبیل (ginger) stage the spiritual wayfarer becomes so much intoxicated with Divine love that, in his overbearing anxiety to meet God, he enquires everywhere and of everyone about the nearest and speediest approach to the Divine threshold.

topics.topic: Paradise: Jannah: rewards of, for the righteous men and women, the martyrs, the muhajirun, the patient, those who fear Allah, the penitent

ar: وَ یَطُوۡفُ عَلَیۡہِمۡ وِلۡدَانٌ  مُّخَلَّدُوۡنَ ۚ اِذَا  رَاَیۡتَہُمۡ حَسِبۡتَہُمۡ  لُؤۡلُؤًا مَّنۡثُوۡرًا ﴿۲۰﴾
ur: اور ان (کی خدمت) پر ہمیشگی عطا کئے ہوئے بچے گھومیں گے۔ جب تُو انہیں دیکھے گا تو انہیں بکھیرے ہوئے موتی گمان کرے گا۔

v5.text: [a]And there will wait upon them youths who will not age. When thou seest them thou thinkest them to be pearls scattered about.

topics.topic: Paradise: Jannah: rewards of, for the righteous men and women, the martyrs, the muhajirun, the patient, those who fear Allah, the penitent

ar: وَ اِذَا  رَاَیۡتَ ثَمَّ رَاَیۡتَ نَعِیۡمًا وَّ مُلۡکًا کَبِیۡرًا ﴿۲۱﴾
ur: اور جب تو نظر دوڑائے گا تو وہاں ایک بڑی نعمت اور ایک بہت بڑا ملک دیکھے گا۔

v5.text: And when thou seest thou wilt see there a bliss and a great kingdom.[4491]

notes.note:
Commentary:

In addition to the spiritual kingdom that the righteous believers have been promised for the Hereafter, they were given mastery of the great empires of the time in this very life.

topics.topic: Paradise: Jannah: rewards of, for the righteous men and women, the martyrs, the muhajirun, the patient, those who fear Allah, the penitent

ar: عٰلِیَہُمۡ  ثِیَابُ سُنۡدُسٍ خُضۡرٌ وَّ اِسۡتَبۡرَقٌ ۫ وَّ حُلُّوۡۤا  اَسَاوِرَ مِنۡ فِضَّۃٍ ۚ وَ  سَقٰہُمۡ  رَبُّہُمۡ  شَرَابًا طَہُوۡرًا ﴿۲۲﴾
ur: ان پر باریک ریشم کے سبز لباس ہوں گے اور موٹے ریشم کے بھی اور وہ چاندی کے کنگن پہنائے جائیں گے اور انہیں اُن کا ربّ شراب طہور پلائے گا۔

v5.text: On them will be garments of fine green silk and thick brocade.[b] And they will be made to wear bracelets of silver.[c] And their Lord will give them to drink a pure beverage.[4492]

notes.note:
Commentary:

At the کافور stage of spiritual journey the God-intoxicated wayfarer is described as himself seeking to drink the wine of God’s love (v. 6) and at the زنجبیل stage, he is served by others with the life-giving beverage (v. 18), but at the last or سلسبیلstage God Himself gives him to drink the elixir of everlasting life.

topics.topic: Jaza’: recompense: of believers, of righteous
Paradise: Jannah: rewards of, for the righteous men and women, the martyrs, the muhajirun, the patient, those who fear Allah, the penitent

ar: اِنَّ  ہٰذَا کَانَ لَکُمۡ جَزَآءً وَّ کَانَ سَعۡیُکُمۡ  مَّشۡکُوۡرًا ﴿٪۲۳﴾
ur: یقیناً یہ ہے جو تمہارے لئے بدلہ کے طور پر ہوگا اور تمہاری سعی مشکور ہوگی۔

v5.text: [d]‘This is your reward, and your labour is appreciated.’[4493]

notes.note:
Commentary:

For a full discussion of the nature, form and scope of the paradisiacal blessings, see chapters 52, 55 & 56. This verse and those preceding it may also apply to the great Divine favours that were bestowed upon the followers of the Holy Prophet in this very life.

ar: اِنَّا نَحۡنُ نَزَّلۡنَا عَلَیۡکَ الۡقُرۡاٰنَ تَنۡزِیۡلًا ﴿ۚ۲۴﴾
ur: یقیناً ہم نے ہی تجھ پر قرآن کو ایک پُرشوکت تدریج کے ساتھ اُتارا ہے۔

v5.text: Surely, We have revealed unto thee the Quran piecemeal.[4494]

notes.note:
Commentary:

The Quran was revealed gradually and piecemeal. Its revelation spread over a period of 23 years. This gradual process served two great purposes. It helped believers to learn, remember and assimilate it and to mould their lives in accordance with its teaching. The gradual process was also intended to meet the increasing needs of changing circumstances and to strengthen the belief and conviction of Muslims, since, during the interval, they had opportunities to witness fulfilment of prophecies made earlier in the Quran. The piecemeal revelation of the Quran also fulfilled the following Biblical prophecy, viz. "For it is precept upon precept; line upon line, here a little and there a little: for with strange lips and another tongue will he speak to this people" (Isaiah 28:11). The construction of the verse and the words used in the Biblical prophecy are expressive of Divine purpose in the gradual revelation of the Quran.

topics.topic: Obey: do not, disbelievers, evil, hypocrites

ar: فَاصۡبِرۡ لِحُکۡمِ رَبِّکَ وَ لَا تُطِعۡ مِنۡہُمۡ اٰثِمًا  اَوۡ  کَفُوۡرًا ﴿ۚ۲۵﴾
ur: پس اپنے ربّ کے حکم (پر عمل) کے لئے مضبوطی سے قائم رہ اور ان میں سے کسی گنہگار اور سخت ناشکرے کی پیروی نہ کر۔

v5.text: So wait patiently for the judgement of thy Lord, and yield not to any sinful or ungrateful one among them.

ar: وَ اذۡکُرِ اسۡمَ  رَبِّکَ بُکۡرَۃً  وَّ اَصِیۡلًا ﴿ۖۚ۲۶﴾
ur: اور اپنے ربّ کے نام کا صبح بھی ذکر کر اور شام کو بھی۔

v5.text: [a]And remember the name of thy Lord morning and evening.

ar: وَ مِنَ الَّیۡلِ فَاسۡجُدۡ لَہٗ  وَ سَبِّحۡہُ  لَیۡلًا طَوِیۡلًا ﴿۲۷﴾
ur: اور رات کے ایک حصّہ میں اس کے حضور سجدہ ریز رہ۔ اور ساری ساری رات اُس کی تسبیح کرتا رہ۔

v5.text: [b]And during the night prostrate thyself before Him, and extol His glory for a long part of the night.

ar: اِنَّ  ہٰۤؤُلَآءِ  یُحِبُّوۡنَ الۡعَاجِلَۃَ  وَ یَذَرُوۡنَ  وَرَآءَہُمۡ  یَوۡمًا ثَقِیۡلًا ﴿۲۸﴾
ur: یقیناً یہ لوگ دنیا سے محبت کرتے ہیں اور اپنے سے پرے ایک بھاری دن کو نظرانداز کر رہے ہیں۔

v5.text: [c]Verily, these people love the present life, and they neglect a heavy day before them.[4495]

notes.note:
Commentary:

The verse purports to say that the hopes and fears of disbelievers are confined to this world. They have no thought for the Hereafter. They want to see promises of prosperity and progress made to Muslims and of those of punishment to themselves fulfilled here and now. But God is not in a hurry to punish. The Holy Prophet is enjoined to pay no heed to their demand for punishment but to prepare himself and his followers morally and spiritually by Night Prayer and glorification of God.

"Heavy day" may mean the Resurrection Day or the Day when disbelievers are punished in this life.

ar: نَحۡنُ خَلَقۡنٰہُمۡ وَ شَدَدۡنَاۤ  اَسۡرَہُمۡ ۚ وَ اِذَا شِئۡنَا بَدَّلۡنَاۤ  اَمۡثَالَہُمۡ  تَبۡدِیۡلًا ﴿۲۹﴾
ur: ہم نے ہی اُن کو پیدا کیا ہے اور اُن کے جوڑ بند مضبوط بنائے ہیں۔ اور جب ہم چاہیں گے ان کی صورتیں یکسر تبدیل کردیں گے۔

v5.text: We have created them and strengthened their make; and when We will, We can replace them by others like them[a].[4496]

notes.note:
Commentary:

This verse, in conjunction with the verses preceding it, means that Truth will spread gradually, either that there will come about a great moral revolution in the lives of the people or if they refused to benefit by the Quranic teaching they will be replaced by another people who will carry out the Divine will and plan. God is not in a hurry to punish them because He "has created man in the best make" (95:5) that he may develop and manifest in himself Divine attributes and not that he may incur His displeasure and be punished.

ar: اِنَّ ہٰذِہٖ  تَذۡکِرَۃٌ ۚ فَمَنۡ شَآءَ  اتَّخَذَ  اِلٰی رَبِّہٖ  سَبِیۡلًا ﴿۳۰﴾
ur: یقیناً یہ ایک بڑی سبق آموز نصیحت ہے پس جو چاہے اپنے ربّ کی طرف (جانے والی) راہ پکڑلے۔

v5.text: [b]Verily, this is a Reminder. So whoever wishes, may take a way unto his Lord.

ar: وَ مَا تَشَآءُوۡنَ  اِلَّاۤ  اَنۡ  یَّشَآءَ اللّٰہُ ؕ اِنَّ اللّٰہَ  کَانَ عَلِیۡمًا حَکِیۡمًا ﴿٭ۖ۳۱﴾
ur: اور تم کچھ بھی نہیں چاہ سکتے (کہ ہو جائے) سوائے اس کے کہ (وہی) اللہ چاہے۔ یقیناً اللہ دائمی علم رکھنے والا (اور) صاحبِ حکمت ہے۔

v5.text: [c]But you will not unless Allah so wills. Verily, Allah is All-Knowing, Wise.[4497]

notes.note:
Commentary:

Besides the meaning given in the text, the verse may also mean: (1) It is God’s Will that you should exercise your will "to take a way unto your Lord," and so be admitted into His mercy. (2) You cannot "take the way unto your Lord" unless you subordinate and conform your will to the will of God. (3) You should have subordinated your will to the will of God, but you seem not to have done so.
